sen.j: 私年号（しねんごう）は、紀年法として元号を用いた東アジアにおいて、安定した統治能力を確立した王朝が定めた元号以外の年号をさす。
sen.e: Shinengo (literally means private nengo; nengo is a name of an era) was the name of an ear which was declared by other than a dynasty that could establish a stable administrating power in South East Asia, where the name of an era was used as the method of counting years.

Shinengo (literally means private nengo; nengo is a name of an era) was the name of an era which was not declared by a dynasty that had a stable administrating power in South East Asia, where the name of an era was used as the method of counting years.
sen.cmt: "ear"→ "era""which was declared by other than a dynasty" → "which was not declared by a dynasty""could establish" → "had"にそれぞれ修正しました。
sen.e: Shinengo (literally means private nengo; nengo is a name of an era) was the name of an era which was not declared by a dynasty that had a stable administrating power in South East Asia, where the name of an era was used as the method of counting years.

sen.j: 異年号、偽年号、僭年号ともいう。
sen.e: It is also said as Inengo (different nengo), Ginengo (pseudo nengo), and Sennengo (impertinent nengo).
It is also called Inengo (different nengo), Ginengo (pseudo nengo), and Sennengo (impertinent nengo).
It is also called Inengo (different nengo), Ginengo (pseudo nengo), and Sennengo (impertinent nengo).

sen.j: 主として時の王朝に対する反乱勢力や批判勢力によって使用されたものが多く、使用期間は概して短い。
sen.e: Shinengo were mainly used by rebels and opponents against then existing dynasty, and their usage period were relatively short.
Shinengo were mainly used by rebels and opponents against then existing dynasty, and their usage period were relatively short.
Shinengo were mainly used by rebels and opponents against then existing dynasty, and their usage period were relatively short.

sen.j: 日本では、正史には記載されていないが、天皇が定めたものとして一部の史書に記載があったり、考古資料に使用例が見られる古代の年号を逸年号と呼び、これに含める場合がある。
sen.e: In Japan, the nengo written in some historical books as declared by the Emperor but not written in official history, or the nengo which was ancient and its use was seen in antique archaeological materials are called Itsunengo (era name which really existed but taken out of official history)-and they are sometimes classified as Shinengo.

In Japan, the nengo written in some historical books as declared by the Emperor but not written in official history, or the nengo which was ancient and its use was seen in antique archaeological materials are called Itsunengo (era name which really existed but taken out of official history)-and they are sometimes classified as Shinengo.

In Japan, the nengo written in some historical books as declared by the Emperor but not written in official history, or the nengo which was ancient and its use was seen in antique archaeological materials are called Itsunengo (era name which really existed but taken out of official history) - and they are sometimes classified as Shinengo.

sen.j: なお、「私年号」を時の王朝に対する対抗的性格の薄いものとし、明確な対抗的意志をもって建てられる「偽年号」「僭（窃）年号」と区別する場合もある。
sen.e: Meanwhile, from the point of view that Shinengo had little intention to oppose the dynasty of the time, they are sometimes regarded as different from `Itsunengo` and `Sennengo or Setsunego (stealing of nengo)` which had a clear rebellious intention.

From the point of view that Shinengo had little intention to oppose the dynasty of the time, they are sometimes regarded as different from `Itsunengo` and `Sennengo or Setsunengo (stealing of nengo)` which had a clear rebellious intention.
sen.cmt: "Setsunego"→"Setsunengo"に修正しました。"Meanwhile" を削除しました。
sen.e: From the point of view that Shinengo had little intention to oppose the dynasty of the time, they are sometimes regarded as different from 'Itsunengo' and 'Sennengo or Setsunengo (stealing of nengo)' which had a clear rebellious intention.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.e: Japanese Shinengo
Japanese Shinengo
Japanese Shinengo

sen.j: 現在までに40以上が確認されている。
sen.e: More than forty Shinengo have been confirmed up to now.
More than forty Shinengo have been confirmed up to now.
More than forty Shinengo have been confirmed up to now.

sen.j: ほとんどが中世に用いられた。
sen.e: Most of them were used in the medieval ages.
Most of them were used in the medieval ages.
Most of them were used in the medieval ages.

sen.j: 改元後も足利成氏が用い続けた享徳も私年号に数えられる。
sen.e: Kyotoku, which Shigeuji ASHIKAGA continued to use as an name of era even after kaigen (changing the name of an era) was declared, can be regarded as Shinengo.
Kyotoku, which Shigeuji ASHIKAGA continued to use as an name of era even after kaigen (changing the name of an era) was declared, can be regarded as Shinengo.
Kyotoku, which Shigeuji ASHIKAGA continued to use as an name of era even after kaigen (changing the name of an era) was declared, can be regarded as Shinengo.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)の東国においては、広範囲にわたって用いられた私年号もあった。
sen.e: In the Sengoku period (period of warring states), there were some Shinengo widely used in Japanese Togoku (literally means eastern countries).
In the Sengoku period (period of warring states), there were some Shinengo widely used in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region)
sen.cmt: Japaneseを削除し、「東国」の説明部分を用語集のもので置き換えました。
sen.e: In the Sengoku period (period of warring states), there were some Shinengo widely used in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region)

sen.j: 公文書などよりも、板碑や過去帳、巡礼札、古社寺縁起などに多く見られる。
sen.e: They are more often seen in Itahi (board monument), Kakocho (a family register of deaths), Junreifuda (pilgrimage tags), and Koshaji engi (writings about the history of old temples and shrines) than in official documents.

They are more often seen in Itahi (board monument), Kakocho (a family register of deaths), Junreifuda (pilgrimage tags), and Koshaji engi (writings about the history of old temples and shrines) than in official documents.

They are more often seen in Itahi (board monument), Kakocho (a family register of deaths), Junreifuda (pilgrimage tags), and Koshaji engi (writings about the history of old temples and shrines) than in official documents.

sen.j: 江戸時代以降も僅かながら用いられる事があった。
sen.e: Though not frequently, but they were used even after the Edo period.
Though not frequently, but they were used even after the Edo period.
Though not frequently, but they were used even after the Edo period.

sen.j: 最も新しいものは、「征露」（明治37年（1904年））。
sen.e: The most recent one was `Seiro (punish Russia),` which was in 1904 (Meiji 37).
The most recent one was `Seiro (which literally means to punish Russia),` which was in 1904 (Meiji 37).
sen.cmt: "punish" の前に"which litterally means to "を追加しました。
sen.e: The most recent one was 'Seiro' (which literally means to punish Russia), which was in 1904 (Meiji 37).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.e: A list of Shinengo in Japan.
A list of Shinengo in Japan.
A list of Shinengo in Japan.
Nengo in ancient times.
Nengo in ancient times.
Nengo in ancient times.
Shinengo after the medieval times.
Shinengo after the medieval times.

Heresies
Heresies
Heresies

sen.j: 九州王朝説九州年号表（鶴峰戊申が、熊襲の年号として考証した年号）を私年号の一種とする解釈もある。
sen.e: There is an interpretation that the Kyushu nengo table of Kyushu dynasty theory (which was nengo historically investigated by Shigenobu TSURUMINE as the nengo of Kumaso [a tribe living in the ancient Kyushu district]) is a kind of Shinengo.

There is an interpretation that the Kyushu nengo table of Kyushu dynasty theory (which was nengo historically investigated by Shigenobu TSURUMINE as the nengo of Kumaso [a tribe living in the ancient Kyushu district]) is a kind of Shinengo.

There is an interpretation that the Kyushu nengo table of Kyushu dynasty theory (which was nengo historically investigated by Shigenobu TSURUMINE as the nengo of Kumaso [a tribe living in the ancient Kyushu district]) is a kind of Shinengo.

sen.j: 九州年号の真実性は現在学界では認められていない。
sen.e: The authenticity of Kyushu nengo is not accepted in today's academic society.
The authenticity of Kyushu nengo is not accepted in today's academic society.
The authenticity of Kyushu nengo is not accepted in today's academic society.
